warningSigns.title: Dangerous curve (A1)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a dangerous curve and its direction.

warningSigns.title: Multiple dangerous curves ahead (A2)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates dangerous curves ahead and gives the direction of the first one.

warningSigns.title: Steep hill downwards (A3)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a steep hill downwards. The numbers indicate the gradient in per cent and is specific to the conditions of the location.

warningSigns.title: Steep incline (A4)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a steep incline. The numbers indicate the gradient in per cent and is specific to the conditions of the location.

warningSigns.title: Road narrows (A5)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates that the road or carriageway narrows. The symbol is specific to the conditions at the location.

warningSigns.title: Uneven road ahead (A8)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates bumps or damage to the road which make it appropriate to travel at a lower speed than what would otherwise be the case.

warningSigns.title: Speed bump warning (A9)
warningSigns.desc: The signs indicate a raised hump or gutter installed as a speed-reducing measure.

warningSigns.title: Slippery road (A10)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates that the road may be slippery. The sign is only used if there are specific reasons to warn of a slippery surface due to snow or ice.

warningSigns.title: Loose chippings (A11)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a risk of loose chippings. The sign is not used on gravel roads or similar roads where loose chippings are common.

warningSigns.title: Falling rocks or debris ahead (A12)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a risk of falling rocks and that there may be fallen rocks on the road. The symbol is adapted to the conditions of the location.

warningSigns.title: Children (A15)
warningSigns.desc: This sign indicates a stretch of road where children often cross or where there are often children on or near the road.

warningSigns.title: Roadworks (A20)
warningSigns.desc: This sign indicates the end of a road section where roadworks or similar works are underway.

warningSigns.title: End of roadworks (A21)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates the end of a road section with roadworks that has been marked with an A20 roadworks sign. The sign is not erected if it is otherwise clear where the section ends.

warningSigns.title: Beware of dangerous crosswinds (A24)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a section of road where there is often a strong crosswind. The symbol is specific to the conditions at the location.

warningSigns.title: Beware of two-way traffic ahead (A25)
warningSigns.desc: This sign indicates that a one-way road is turning into a road with traffic in both directions.

warningSigns.title: Soft verge or high carriageway edge (A27)
Junction (A28)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a junction where the provisions of Chapter 3, Section 18 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (1998:1276) apply.

warningSigns.title: Warning for a junction where road users on a connecting road are obliged to give way or stop (A29)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a junction where drivers of vehicles on connecting roads are obliged to give way or stop. The symbol is adapted to the conditions of the location.

warningSigns.title: Level crossing with gates (A35)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a junction with a railway or tramway line with gates.

warningSigns.title: Distance to level crossing (A38)
warningSigns.desc: The signs indicate the distance to a level crossing in a three-bar system. The sign with the three bars is, except for in densely populated areas, erected under one of the following signs; A35, Level crossing with gates, A36, Level crossing without gates, or A37, Junction with tramway line. The sign with two bars indicates that it is two-thirds the distance to the level crossing and the sign with one bar indicates the last third of the distance.

warningSigns.title: Train crossing (A39)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates a crossing railway or tramway with one or more tracks. The sign is posted immediately prior to a level crossing. It does not have to be posted on a private road with limited traffic where it can be omitted without threatening traffic safety. The sign can also be posted at unlevel railway or tramway crossings.

warningSigns.title: Other dangers (A40)
warningSigns.desc: The sign indicates dangers other than such that can be indicated with some other warning sign. The nature of the danger is specified on an additional panel.
